subsection_name: viem-than-be-than-cap.json_2_Causes of acute pyelonephritis kidney disease
subsection_content:
Acute pyelonephritis is an infection that usually begins in the urinary tract as a urinary tract infection. Bacteria enter the body through the urethra and begin to multiply and spread to the bladder. From there, the bacteria travel through the ureters to the kidneys.
The main bacteria that attack humans and cause illness are gram-negative bacteria such as E.Coli, Klebsiella, Proteus mirabilis, and Enterobacter. In addition, Gram-positive bacteria can still cause disease, but are rare such as: Staphylococcus, streptococcus...
Bacteria that cause pyelonephritis are easy to attack if they encounter favorable conditions such as:
The patient is suffering from lower urinary tract infection; People who have just had surgery on the urinary system; People with urinary tract obstruction due to diseases: stones, tumors...; Patients with inflammatory foci such as: gynecological infections, prostatitis, proctitis, cystitis...
subsection_title: viem than be than cap.json. Causes of acute pyelonephritis kidney disease
subsection_data:
